article.text: A car exploded today outside a police station in Turkish town Kayseri. According to media report, a suicide bomber detonated a bomb being inside a car killing himself, and a police officer. Twenty other people were wounded. Neither of the Islamist militants, Kurdish separatists, including al Qaeda and other groups from the far right and left has claimed responsibility for the attack. The bomber attempted to enter the police station but failed. The explosion happened right before he went in, wounding at least 19 people around, and seriously injuring 6. An employee, Hasan Gumus, working at the Pinarbasi district governor's office 2 km away said that he heard a loud explosion. One Kayseri police officer said that he could not reach Pinarbasi police at the moment neither by land line nor cell phones. He added that 1 police officer was killed and 19 people were wounded, but he did not specify the number of civilians.
